activities: We work with publishers, advertising technology companies, our clients and other data sources to collect or generate information about individual or device activity, characteristics or preferences.  In some cases, we receive contact information of individuals to whom our clients would like to target advertising, such as a list of email addresses.  The information described above is used primarily to provide relevant advertising and related analytics and data services. We also receive personal information of our business contacts, such as during the registration process, and we use this information primarily for our account management and marketing purposes.  Finally, we receive human resources data from our European affiliates, which we use for human resource management and legal compliance purposes.  More detail on all of these topics appears in our Privacy Policy and our HR Safe Harbor Privacy Policy.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: The following personal data is covered: (i) data about past, current and prospective customers of our clients, (ii) contact information of our business contacts, such as those that register on our website, and (iii) human resource data from our European affiliates.  This includes data processed manually and through automated means.
recoursemech: We encourage any person with a complaint to contact the AdRoll privacy office directly at privacy@adroll.com.  Complaints regarding human resources data also can be lodged with the local human resources representative of the relevant AdRoll affiliate.  If we are unable to address the complaint to the person’s satisfaction, we agree to cooperate with (1) the relevant EU and Swiss data protection authorities, with respect to organization HR data and (2) the International Centre for Dispute Resolution / American Arbitration Association Safe Harbor Dispute Resolution Program, with respect to other data.
